opentopic:map.title: Getting Started with the Operator Interface

topic.title: Deploying Code in Production

body.p: Deploy the OI to run in a production environment, including installing the required packages, connecting the OI to the server, cconfiguring the station/lot settings, etc.

topic.domains: (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
topic.title: Operator Interface Environment

body.p: Use the operator interface to run tests, monitor test status, and save the test results to a local directory or a remote server. The operator interface has two user interfaces: the main panel and the default operator interface.
Use the following test status indicators on the operator interface to monitor test program status.

row.entry: Displays the current status of the tester.
Displays statistical and status information for each site.
Displays the value of relevant station settings and lot settings for the loaded test program.
Displays information about the binning of DUTs for the current lot, such as the names of the soft bins, the associated hard bins, and the DUT counts for each site.
Displays statistical information for a lot execution.

topic.domains: (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
topic.title: Running the Test Program

ol.li: Double-click the Semi OI icon on the desktop to launch the Operator Interface.

When prompted, select Operator or MES, depending on the mode in which you want to run the OI.
Operator—Run the OI in operator mode, which requires you to enter all the information in the .mes file.
MES—Run the OI in message mode, which requires you to enter only a subset of the information in the .mes file.
Click Start Lot on the main panel.
Enter the Customer ID, Program Name, and Mode Code as defined in BarCodeDefinition.txt.
Click Download to download the test program from the server.
After the download is complete, enter information in the dialog box that appears, such as Operator_ID, Device_Name, etc, as defined in BarCodeDefinition.txt and Mesfile.mes.
Confirm the lot information and click OK.
When the Wait for SOT dialog box appears, click Single Test or Start Lot on the default operator interface, depending on whether you want to run a single test or continuous tests.

Monitor the test status and perform the following steps when necessary.
To pause testing at any time, click Pause.
To resume a paused test, click Resume.
To test a single batch of parts and automatically pause after testing completes, click Single Test.
To stop testing the lot, click End Lot.
To test a new lot, configure the new lot settings, then repeat the previous steps.
To close the test application, click Exit.
9.
10.

When the test completes, perform the following steps when necessary.
To save the test result and upload it to the server, click Save Test Result on the main panel.
To start the next test, click Start Lot on the default OI.
To stop running the lot, click Full Lot End on the main panel.
To stop running any tests, click Exit on the main panel.

topic.title: Test Program and Data Structure

body.p: The following figure shows the package structure of the test program, in which orange indicates files, green indicates test program and recipe packages, and the rest indicates folders. Pay special attention to the way the folders are named.

fig.title: Test Program Structure
fig.note: To modify the package structure, contact NI engineers. Note that some of paths and folder names can be customized in the env_config.txt file.

When packaging files or folders, place them at the top level of the package file rather than a folder with the same name as the package file. For example, .../ZipFileName.zip/ ModeCode_recipe.cfgis correct while.../ZipFileName.zip/ ZipFileName/ ModeCode_recipe.cfg is wrong.
fig.p: The following figure shows the structure of the test data, in which orange indicates files and blue indicates folders. To modify the path of data log, contact NI engineers.

table.title: Test Data Folders and Files Details

row.entry: Converted from the tester summary in a fixed .csv format, which is generated by clicking Save Test Result each time. It is used for the information acquisition for the summarization summary.html.
Records lot information, start and end time, version information, and conversion summary.csv path. It is generated by clicking Save Test Result each time.

Comes from conversion summary.csv and config information according to certain calculation logic, which is generated by clicking Full Lot End . It is used to combine multiple conversion summary.csv files into one set as well as to view test results in the production line.

Comes from conversion summary.csv and config information according to certain calculation logic, which is generated by clicking Full Lot End. It is used to combine multiple conversion summary.csv fileinto one set as well as to transfer in the production line, which is different from summarization summary.html.
Records detailed operation steps, alarm information, and judgment results. The data is saved in real time.
Includes the tester summary and tester stdf, which are generated by the tester.
